questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the three levels of biodiversity?

choices.answer: Species
Genetic
Ecosystem
Richness

questions.question: Which of the following is true of genetic diversity and environmental disruptions

choices.answer: Natural disturbances increase gen. div., human disturbances decrease it
Genetic diversity makes populations more resistant to env. disturbances
Genetic diversity makes ecosystems more resistant to disruptions
Genetic diversity increases after any disturbance to an ecosystem

questions.question: How does species richness relate to ecosystem resilience?

choices.answer: High species richness = high resillience
Low species richness = high resillience
Species richness decreases as ecosystems recover from disturbances
Species richness increases after environmental disturbances

questions.question: Habitat loss impacts generalist species more than specialist species:

choices.answer: True; generalist species have higher pop. sizes so they suffer more loss
True; generalists have more specific habitat needs and are less tolerant
False; generalists have fewer habitat needs & are more tolerant of change
False; habitat loss impacts generalists and specialists the same

questions.question: Which of the following is not a provisioning ecosystem service of trees?

choices.answer: Lumber
Oxygen
Filtration of ground water
Fruit

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a supporting ecosystem service?

choices.answer: Wetlands filtering pollutants from rainwater
Tourists paying to visit the Everglades
Scientists performing a study on air quality in the Amazon
Trees removing CO2 from the atmosphere, reducing global warming from CC

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an anthropogenic activity that could disrupt a supporting ecosystem service?

choices.answer: Removal of native praries that contain wildflowers to build a highway
A forest fire that burns down a stand of trees being logged for lumber
A fungal infection that spreads and reduces bee populations by 40%
All are anthropogenic activities that could disrupt a supporting service

questions.question: Why do islands tend to have more specialist species than generalist species?

choices.answer: Generalist species aren't able to migrate to and colonize islands
Generalist species have populations that are too large to live on islands
Islands have fewer available food & habitat resources than mainlands
All of the above are reasons islands have more specialists than generalists

questions.question: Why do islands farther from the mainland have lower species richness than closer ones?

choices.answer: Fewer species are able to migrate to farther islands
Farther islands are smaller and have fewer resources than closer ones
Farther islands broke off and separated from the mainland longer ago
Fewer species can tolerate the harsh conditions on farther-away islands

questions.question: Which of the following is a factor in determining the ecological tolerance of a species?

choices.answer: Temperature & Precipitation
Intraspecific competition
Food resource availability
Habitat availability

questions.question: What happens when an environmental disturbance shifts habitat conditions outside the range of tolerance of a species?

choices.answer: The species migrates to a new habitat
The local population of that species dies out
Genetic diversity allows the species to adapt to the new conditions
All of the above can happen to a population after habitat disturbance

questions.question: Which of the following is the best example of an exclusively natural (non-anthropogenic) ecosystem disturbance?

choices.answer: Forest fires
Tornadoes
Disease
Flooding

questions.question: Which of the following DOES NOT contribute global to sea level rise?

choices.answer: Increasing global temperature leading to thermal expansion of ocean water
Increasing global temperature leading to more frequent precipitation
Melting of polar ice caps
Melting of glaciers on land

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a reason that a species would migrate?

choices.answer: Reproduction
To find an available food source
Habitat destruction
All of the above are reasons a species would migrate

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an example of an adaptation?

choices.answer: Sharp teeth in wolves that allow them to tear deer meat more easily
Bright colored feathers that allow male birds to attract mates successfully
A monkey learning to eat a new type of fruit that had more nutrients
A genetic mutation that makes corn produce a toxin that deters beetles

questions.question: How do adaptations arise in populations?

choices.answer: Random, genetic mutations produce new, advantageous traits
Natural selection kills off weak organisms
Environmental changes make old traits obsolete
Individuals learn new behaviors and develop new traits in order to survive

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an example of a selective force for tail length in monkeys?

choices.answer: Predation by jaguars
Drought that impacts tree growth
The spread of a new disease
Female sexual selection

questions.question: Which of the following determines whether a species experiences extinction or evolution in response to env. change?

choices.answer: The rate of the environmental change
The genetic diversity of the species
The ecological tolerance of the species
The food and shelter requirements of the species

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an example of a keystone species?

choices.answer: Panda
Wolf
Beaver
Mangrove trees

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key characteristic of keystone species?

choices.answer: They create habitats that other organisms utilize
They control herbivore populations
They leave carcasses that scavengers depend on
They have large population sizes

questions.question: How do lichen and mosses initiate primary succession?

choices.answer: They secrete acids onto rocks, leading to chemical weathering
They have roots that attach to rock and physically break it down
They recycle nutrients, making soil rich for pioneer species
They provide a key habitat for decomposers that lead to nutrient-rich soil

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key characteristic of pioneer species?

choices.answer: Fast growing
Tolerant of full sunlight
High soil nutrient requirements
Hardiness

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a climax species?

choices.answer: Maple Trees
Shrubs
Moss
Ragweed
